td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Sends word that being aware of the Trouble & Misery which Martin & his companions might undergo were they overloaded – thought it more expedient to Keep the Provns untill the winter when he will come to the Fort himself with them on Sledges[.] [C]onsequently Martin brought but a very trifling Quantity[.] Beaulieu tells me that the natives below have upwards of 16 Cashes Some as large as my Room – but no Furrs[.] Concerning the Dahotinnais, Beaulieu who had made one of the Party that had been in quest of them – says that they saw several Cashes of Provns belonging to thisat Tribe but could discover none of their vestiges[.] However the Grand Chefre will not leave those Quarters untill he either sees them or is sure that they are not to be found – and sends word accordingly – But I believe the old Rascal cleaves a faster hold at his Provns that intentious purposes of obtaining the Dahotinnais[.] General Montgomery also dispatches a young man to let me Know if I will recieve him he will very readily come to this Place – as he is together with Grand Chefre[.] [H]is reasons for wishing to Sprout up this way is on account of the murder of the Deceased Pascal Sauvé the perpetrator of which was one of his band and whose friends & relations are all there – then fears of going to Bear Lake is the cause of this message[.] I however did not think my duty to give him any encouragement – but sent him word that he should return to Bear Lake where if he & his band worked well & were not concerned in the above mentd deed – they would in all propability be recieved accordingly[.] Understanding that several of the Indians had thrown away a great number of Martin, Pichoux & Carcajoux Skins – on account of what I had told them in the Fall – I thought it would not be amiss to let them know that whatever they had already Killed, would be accepted as many of them who have old debts will not be able to pay them if I Should refuse this[.] Rather than get nothing I will take these but at the same time I gave them to understand that they must endeavour to add some Beaver[.] Jollibois took another red Fox in the Steel Trap[.] Grand River full of Ice[.]

Sunday 9th[.] As it was too late last night to take account of what the above Indians brought – I recieved to day to the Amount of 35½ Skins in Peltries & 42 in Provisions – weight 300lb of Fat, Grease & Dried & half Green meat[.] 6½ Skins of the Former I traded together with 29 Skins of the Latter, from some he who paid their Debts over & above[.]
